column3:
He had been parked there for seven minutes already; he could only afford a few more before someone might become suspicious.
"C'mon. . . c'mon," he was muttering. "Let's get this over with."
He checked his watch: 6:32 a.m.

BURBANK AIRPORT
6:32 A.M.
Rush hour traffic crept forward in the pale morning light. Casey twisted her rearview mirror, and leaned over to check her makeup.

The familiar radium numerals on my left wrist confirmed the clock tower. It was twenty-eight minutes to seven. I seemed to be filling a set of loud maroon pajamas which were certainly not mine. My vis-a-vis was wearing a little number in yellow.
